summary: VP6 is a unique structural protein of the middle of three capsid layers of the rotavirus (see Figure 1). it contains 397 amino acids, and has a molecular mass of 45 kDa. VP6 is the most conserved, immunogenic, and abundant rotavirus protein. this antigen is considered the major diagnostic marker for acute rotavirus gastroenteritis. VLPs are a safe and efficacious class of vaccine, with approved members available for hepatitis B and cervical cancer. the current demand for VLPs is primarily as products for vaccination. other applications, including diagnostics, biomedicine, material science, and nanotechnology, are increasingly attracting general scientific interest. a hexahistidine SUMO fusion construct has been shown to enhance expression and facilitate purification by means of nickel-nitrilotriacetic acid (Ni+2-NTA) chromatography. traditional gene-fusion systems require engineered cleavage sites, which are recognized by the proteases and are positioned between the fusion tag and the protein target.
